summary: This document is an email chain between attorney Gloria Allred and an Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York, discussing the scheduling of a meeting on August 19, 2019, for one of Allred's clients, an Epstein victim, to meet with federal prosecutors. It reveals coordination for victim travel and testimony.

persons.name: Gloria Allred
persons.context: High-profile attorney communicating with federal prosecutors to arrange a meeting for her client, an Epstein victim, to provide testimony.

persons.name: Diane Aldrich
persons.context: Allred's assistant, referenced as the contact for federal agents to arrange travel details for the victim.

connections.description: Allred directs the federal agent to contact her assistant, Diane Aldrich, to arrange travel details for her client.
Professional correspondence regarding scheduling a meeting for an Epstein victim to provide information to federal prosecutors.

events.title: Scheduled Meeting with Federal Prosecutors
events.description: A meeting scheduled at the SDNY office for Gloria Allred and her client, an Epstein victim, to meet with federal prosecutors.

locations: Southern District of New York office
keyFacts: Gloria Allred, a prominent attorney, was arranging for an Epstein victim client to fly from Los Angeles to New York to meet with federal prosecutors on August 19, 2019.
The correspondence indicates federal prosecutors (SDNY) were actively seeking testimony from Epstein victims shortly after his arrest in July 2019.
The emails show logistical coordination, including the victim's desire to fly on the same Delta flight as Allred and the involvement of a federal agent to handle travel arrangements.
A previous client of Allred's had initially decided not to meet with prosecutors, but another client subsequently agreed to do so.
The communication is marked as confidential and legally privileged, indicating the sensitive nature of the victim's cooperation.
